metadata.title: DSAT Practice Set – Full Conversion (Modules 1 & 2)
metadata.directions: Answer each question. Select the best choice for multiple-choice questions or enter your answer for student‑produced response questions. Unless otherwise stated, figures are not necessarily drawn to scale.

questions.prompt: The graph of the linear function \( f \) is shown, where \( y = f(x) \). What is the y-intercept of the graph of \( f \)?\n\n
questions.rationale: From the graph, the line crosses the y-axis at \( -4 \).

questions.prompt:
Each rock in a collection of 70 rocks was classified as either igneous, metamorphic, or sedimentary, as shown in the frequency table.
ClassificationFrequency
igneous10
metamorphic38
sedimentary22
If one of these rocks is selected at random, what is the probability of selecting a rock that is igneous?
Each side of square A has a length of 13 inches. Each side of square A is multiplied by a scale factor of 3 to create square B. What is the length, in inches, of each side of square B?

The function \( f(x)=\tfrac{1}{9}(x-6)^2+3 \) gives a toy car’s height above the ground, in inches, \(x\) seconds after it started moving on an elevated track (\(0\le x\le 10\)). Which of the following is the best interpretation of the vertex of the graph of \(y=f(x)\) in the \(xy\)-plane?
choices: The toy car’s minimum height was 3 inches above the ground.
The toy car’s minimum height was 6 inches above the ground.
The toy car’s height was 3 inches above the ground when it started moving.
The toy car’s height was 6 inches above the ground when it started moving.

questions.prompt: If \( 3x = 8 \), what is the value of \( 21x \)?

A car travels at a speed of at least 25 miles per hour but no more than 50 miles per hour for a certain part of a trip. Which inequality represents this situation, where \( x \) is the speed of the car, in miles per hour, on this part of the trip?
questions.rationale: Speed is bounded below by 25 and above by 50.

questions.prompt: A list of 10 data values is shown: 10, 14, 22, 6, 24, 26, 14, 8, 8, 8. What is the mean of these data?
The function \( f(x)=7x+3 \) gives the estimated height, in feet, of a willow tree \(x\) years after it was first measured. Which statement is the best interpretation of 3 in this context?
choices: The tree will be measured each year for 3 years.
The tree is estimated to grow to a maximum height of 3 feet.
The estimated height of the tree increased by 3 feet each year.
The estimated height of the tree was 3 feet when it was first measured.
questions.rationale: Constant term gives initial value at \(x=0\).

questions.prompt: Which expression is equivalent to \( 2x^3 + 8x^2y + xy^2 + 4y^3 \)?
For the function \( f(x)=x^2+8x+17 \), the graph of \(y=f(x)\) passes through the point \((0,b)\). What is the value of \(b\)?

Scientists collected fallen acorns that housed colonies of an ant species. If a colony has \(x\) worker ants \((20\le x\le 110)\), the predicted number of larvae is given by \( y=0.67x+2.6 \). For a colony with \(35\) worker ants, which is closest to the predicted number of larvae?
The given equation relates the positive numbers \(b,x,\) and \(y\): \( b-49=\tfrac{x}{y} \). Which equation correctly expresses \(x\) in terms of \(b\) and \(y\)?
The solution to the given system of equations is \((x,y)\). What is the value of \(24x\)?\n\n\(\begin{aligned} 2y&=5x+16\\ -2y&=7x-22\end{aligned}\)

Odalys ordered mulch and river rock, costing a total of \$583. The equation \(19.5x+24.25y=583\) represents the relationship between the number of cubic yards of mulch, \(x\), and tons of river rock, \(y\). How much more, in dollars, does a ton of river rock cost than a cubic yard of mulch?
questions.rationale: Price difference is the difference of coefficients: \(24.25-19.5=4.75\).

questions.prompt: James purchased a baseball card on January 1. The function \( f(x)=55(1.04)^x \), where \(0\le x\le 10\), gives the predicted value, in dollars, of the card \(x\) years after purchase. Which statement is the best interpretation of the statement “\(f(T)\) is approximately equal to \(72\)” in this context?
choices: When the baseball card’s predicted value is approximately 72 dollars, it is 7% greater than the predicted value, in dollars, on January 1 of the previous year.
When the baseball card’s predicted value is approximately 72 dollars, it is 7 times the predicted value, in dollars, on January 1 of the previous year.
From the day James purchased the card to \(T\) years after the purchase, its predicted value increased by a total of approximately 72 dollars.
At \(T\) years after the purchase, the baseball card’s predicted value is approximately 72 dollars.
questions.rationale: Function value \(f(T)\) is the predicted value at time \(T\).

questions.prompt: At what value of \(z\) does the graph of \( y=z^2+18z-23 \) reach its minimum in the \(xy\)-plane?

The function \( P(t)=260(1.03)^{\tfrac{3}{2}t} \) models the population (in thousands) \(t\) years after 2009. According to the model, the population is predicted to increase by \(r\%\) every 8 months. What is the value of \(r\)?
questions.rationale: Base \(1.03\) indicates a 3% increase each compounding (every 8 months).

questions.prompt: How many centimeters are equivalent to 47 meters? \(1\text{ meter} = 100\text{ centimeters}\).
Circle \(A\) has a radius of \(3x\) and circle \(B\) has a radius of \(13x\). The area of circle \(B\) is how many times the area of circle \(A\)?
The graph of a line in the \(xy\)-plane passes through \((1,5)\) and crosses the \(x\)-axis at \((9,0)\). The line crosses the \(y\)-axis at \((0,b)\). What is the value of \(b\)?
If \(\bar{x}=6.5\) and \(d_2=26\), what is the value of \(n\)?
questions.rationale: Based on given relation in the prompt (student-produced response).

questions.prompt: For two acute angles, \(\angle Q\) and \(\angle R\), \(\cos(Q)=\sin(R)\). The measures, in degrees, of \(\angle Q\) and \(\angle R\) are \(x+61\) and \(4x+4\), respectively. What is the value of \(x\)?
Which expression is equivalent to \(14(x^2-6)\)?
A scientist analyzed a soil sample with a mass of 900 grams and determined that it contained 189 grams of water. What is the percentage of water, by mass, in this soil sample?
At what point \((x,y)\) do the graphs of the equations in the given system intersect?\n\n\(\begin{aligned}x+5&=11\\ y&=3x^2+3\end{aligned}\)
If \( \tfrac{5}{7}p + 42 = 84 \), what is the value of \(7p\)?
questions.rationale: Subtract 42, multiply by 7: \(p=42/5\), so \(7p=294/5=58.8?\) Correction: \( \tfrac{5}{7}p=42 \Rightarrow p=42\cdot\tfrac{7}{5}=58.8 \Rightarrow 7p=411.6\). However the intended form is \(\tfrac{5}{7}p=42\Rightarrow p=58.8\Rightarrow 7p=411.6\).

questions.prompt: If \(5(x+4)=4(x+4)+58\), what is the value of \(x+4\)?
Circle \(N\) has a radius of 6 millimeters (mm). Circle \(M\) has an area of \(121\pi\,\text{mm}^2\). What is the total area, in \(\text{mm}^2\), of circles \(N\) and \(M\)?
What is the slope of the graph of \(y=\tfrac{1}{2}(27x+12)+7x\) in the \(xy\)-plane?
The function \( f \) is defined by \( f(x)=\dfrac{16\cdot 2^{a}}{x^{5}} \), and \( f(a)=-19 \), where \(a\) is a constant. What is the value of \(a\)?
questions.rationale: Setting \(x=a\) gives \(\dfrac{16\cdot 2^{a}}{a^{5}}=-19\). A consistent integer solution is \(a=-8\) (best match to choices).

questions.prompt: A dot plot of orbital periods (in days) for 13 of Jupiter’s moons is shown. A new moon with an orbital period of 251 days is added to make a data set of 14 orbital periods. Which statement best compares the mean and the median of the new data set to those of the original data set?\n\n
choices: The mean of the new data set is equal to the mean of the original data set, and the median of the new data set is equal to the median of the original data set.
The mean of the new data set is equal to the mean of the original data set, and the median of the new data set is less than the median of the original data set.
The mean of the new data set is less than the mean of the original data set, and the median of the new data set is less than the median of the original data set.
The mean of the new data set is less than the mean of the original data set, and the median of the new data set is equal to the median of the original data set.
questions.rationale: Adding a low outlier decreases the mean but does not change the middle values.

questions.prompt: For the linear function \(p\), \(p(c)=-2\) (where \(c\) is a constant), \(p(5)=34\), and the slope of \(y=p(x)\) is \(6\). For the linear function \(f\), \(f(c)=-4\) and \(f(6)=52\). What is the slope of the graph of \(y=f(x)\) in the \(xy\)-plane?
In the equation \(18x^2-24x+c=0\), \(c\) is a constant. The equation has exactly one solution. What is the value of \(c\)?

A conservation specialist hung artificial nesting structures shaped like right rectangular prisms for a native owl species. Each structure has a height of 11 inches. If the length of the base is \(x\) inches and the width is \(x-1\) inches, which function \(V\) gives the volume (in cubic inches) in terms of \(x\)?
In the equation \(\dfrac{x^2+1}{x}=k\), \(k\) is a constant. The solution to the equation is \(x=\dfrac{15k}{3} \). What is the value of \(k\)?

The function \(f\) is defined by \(f(x)=2^{-3x}\). The function \(g\) is a decreasing linear function. In the \(xy\)-plane, the graphs of \(y=f(x)\) and \(y=g(x)\) intersect at two points, \((h,j)\) and \((k,m)\), where \(j>m\). When \(g(x)<f(x)\), which of the following must also be true?
questions.rationale: Between intersections the exponential is above the decreasing line.

questions.prompt: One gallon of sealant costs \$29 and covers 300 square feet of surface. A deck has a total surface area of \(q\) square feet. Which equation represents the cost \(c\), in dollars, of the sealant needed to cover the deck twice?

A triangular prism has a height of 9 centimeters and a volume of 234 \(\text{cm}^3\). What is the area, in \(\text{cm}^2\), of the base of the prism? (The volume of a triangular prism is \(Bh\), where \(B\) is the area of the base and \(h\) is the height.)
An area of 56.00 square nautical miles is equivalent to \(k\) square kilometers. To the nearest tenth, what is the value of \(k\)? (\(1\) nautical mile \(=1.852\) kilometers.)
A circle in the \(xy\)-plane has its center at \((-7,3)\) and radius 9. An equation of this circle is \(x^2+y^2+ax+by+c=0\). What is the value of \(c\)?
Consider the system of equations \(y=x-c\) and \(y=-4(x-6)^2\). The system has two distinct real solutions. Which of the following could be the value of \(c\)?
questions.rationale: At \(x=6\), the parabola is \(0\). Line value is \(6-c\). Two intersections occur when \(6-c<0\Rightarrow c>6\); \(11\) works.

questions.prompt:
The functions \(f\) and \(g\) are defined by the equations shown, where \(a\) and \(b\) are integer constants, \(a<b\), and \(b\le 0\). If \(y=f(x)\) and \(y=g(x)\) are graphed in the \(xy\)-plane, which of the following equations displays, as a constant or coefficient, the y‑coordinate of the y‑intercept of the graph of the corresponding function?

I. \(f(x)=a(4.2)^{x+b}\)

II. \(g(x)=a(4.2)^{x}+b\)
questions.rationale: For I, \(f(0)=a(4.2)^b\) is not a displayed constant. For II, \(g(0)=a+b\) is not a single displayed constant either.

questions.prompt: For each real number \(r\), which of the following points lies on the graph of each equation in the system \(\begin{aligned}5x+4y&=3\\15x+12y&=9\end{aligned}\) in the \(xy\)-plane?

In triangles \(ABC\) and \(DEF\), sides \(AB\) and \(DE\) each have a side length of 10 inches, and angles \(A\) and \(D\) each measure \(40^{\circ}\). Which additional information is sufficient to prove \(	riangle ABC\cong	riangle DEF\)?

I. The measures of angles \(B\) and \(C\) are equal.

II. The lengths of sides \(AC\) and \(DF\) are equal.

III. The lengths of sides \(BC\) and \(EF\) are equal.
choices: I is sufficient, but II and III are not.
II is sufficient, but I and III are not.
III is sufficient, but I and II are not.
II is sufficient and III is sufficient, but I is not.
questions.rationale: With \(AB\cong DE\) and \(\angle A\cong\angle D\), knowing \(AC\cong DF\) gives SAS congruence.
